issue.title: Examples of sending a message to Direct
issue.body:
Can I send messages to direct?
For example, as in [link](https://github.com/dilame/instagram-private-api/blob/3e1605831996c19e59f7b91461eea3539cd3521f/src/repositories/direct-thread.repository.ts#L223)

comment.body:
> await ig.realtime.direct.sendText(text, clientContext, threadId) doesn't work.

The method takes an object, not a string. `sendText({text, clientContext, threadId})` (correct) â‰  `sendText(text, clientContext, threadId)` (incorrect).

Also some general advice: Consider using typescript or an editor that typeckecks your code (it should've warned you about passing a string). `clientContext` is almost never needed.

> btw, clientContext == message.client_context ?

Should be the case but don't quote me on that, since I haven't looked at it recently.

issue.title: Examples of sending a message to Direct
issue.body:
Can I send messages to direct?
For example, as in [link](https://github.com/dilame/instagram-private-api/blob/3e1605831996c19e59f7b91461eea3539cd3521f/src/repositories/direct-thread.repository.ts#L223)

comment.body:
Please provide working example of dm using real-time API. 
 await ig.realtime.direct.sendText(text, clientContext, threadId) doesn't work.

btw, clientContext == message.client_context ?

forkee.name: instagram_mqtt
forkee.description: Realtime and Push Notification (FBNS) support for the instagram-private-api

issue.title: realtime client doesnt work in v1
realtime client doesnt work in v1
realtime client doesnt work in v1
realtime client doesnt work in v1

comment.body: i am using insta.js and it uses v0 and listening only receive event and then solve the topic and payload in another function

issue.title: realtime client doesnt work in v1

comment.body:
I don't see a use-case for this. But if you really want to listen to everything the client receives, listen to _message_ on the mqtt client: `ig.realtime.mqtt.on('message', ...)`.

But as I said, I don't see a use-case for this. Everything is already logged and to handle specific topics you'd branch in your code anyways since the messages don't share a common structure.

issue.title: realtime client doesnt work in v1

comment.body:
> You're only listening on `receive` which is emitted for topics that don't have a specific parser. Take a look at the [example](https://github.com/Nerixyz/instagram_mqtt/blob/master/examples/realtime.example.ts#L16-L20).

so how can i listen all events with topic
like in v0

issue.title: realtime client doesnt work in v1

comment.body: You're only listening on `receive` which is emitted for topics that don't have a specific parser. Take a look at the [example](https://github.com/Nerixyz/instagram_mqtt/blob/master/examples/realtime.example.ts#L16-L20).

pull_request.title: chore(deps): bump minimist from 1.2.5 to 1.2.6
pull_request.body:
Bumps [minimist](https://github.com/substack/minimist) from 1.2.5 to 1.2.6.
Commits
  • 7efb22a 1.2.6
  • ef88b93 security notice for additional prototype pollution issue
  • c2b9819 isConstructorOrProto adapted from PR
  • bc8ecee test from prototype pollution PR
  • See full diff in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=minimist&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=1.2.5&new-version=1.2.6)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot use these labels` will set the current labels as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these reviewers` will set the current reviewers as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these assignees` will set the current assignees as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use this milestone` will set the current milestone as the default for future PRs for this repo and language You can disable automated security fix PRs for this repo from the [Security Alerts page](https://github.com/Nerixyz/instagram_mqtt/network/alerts).
